title: information design typeface
content:
Hello everyone,

I’m looking for an information design typeface, and I’m hoping you can recommend some. It will be used to produce big,complicated, technical documents for an architectural practice. So far, I’ve been using what’s available to me, which is various weights of Bt Swiss (their in-house face ... I know ... ) for headers and titles, and verdana for a lot of the nitty gritty stuff. (Verdana works surprisingly well as a text face at about six or seven point. The numerals are great.)

What I’d like is something that’s a bit more elegant than verdana, that stands up to being used big. Or, something like helvetica, but more suitable for text, with robust numerals. It would also be nice if it was Opentype, so it can be installed on my work pc and my home mac, but this isn’t vital. It would be nice to have a good selection of weights, from a light to a black or even ultra.It should preferably have a cool, geometric atmosphere, rather than a humanist one.

So far I’ve looked at FF Unit and FF Zwo, which are both really nice, but Unit is rather loosely spaced for my taste, and Zwo isn’t available in Opentype.Are there any other faces that do what I’m after?

comments.content: You might look at FF Fago

How about these three new releases?

[Agilita](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/www.linotype.com/183977/agilita-family.html) (don’t mind the display on the hairline weights! They need to be printed large; quite larger than on scrren here. But the normal and heavier weights look juicy even in our online disply)  
 [Aptifer Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/www.linotype.com/137226/aptifersans-family.html)  
 [Aptifer Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/www.linotype.com/137269/aptiferslab-family.html)
Thanks for the suggestions chaps. I will download some specimens and do some scrutinising. Any more?

Etelka from Storm (offers wide and narrow, also)  
 [http://www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-15-etelka](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-15-etelka "http://www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-15-etelka")

or

“a modern Frutiger”, Corpid (offers condensed, too) from Luc de Groot  
 [http://www.lucasfonts.com/index\_neu.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/index_neu.html "http://www.lucasfonts.com/index\_neu.html")

or

hehe, I second FF Milo

Fago is rubbish mate, crap spacing and a bit of a copycat of the Speikerman vibe if you ask me! Unit is really good, I’ve seen it used really well. What about FF Info? Or Flame: [http://vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/") Or Galaxy Polaris: [http://vllg.com/Village/GalaxiePolaris/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103926/http:/vllg.com/Village/GalaxiePolaris/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Village/GalaxiePolaris/mudTyper+Weights/")

Good luck with it mate! Heaps of good choices out there.
